intro: Linaria atrofusca, commonly known as the dark-flowered toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its striking dark purple to almost black flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Linaria atrofusca is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique coloration.
